column1: These are difficult and unprecedented times. We must do all we can to continue to limit the spread of this devastating disease.  We will get through this and we will persevere together. Please have a safe happy and healthy holiday season from my family to yours. 6/6

For more than 250000 families around the country today marks the first Thanksgiving and the first of many holidays without a loved one due to the coronavirus. My team and I extend our deepest sympathies and condolences to those mourning. 5/
In addition to that gratitude I’m also thinking of the pain this holiday will bring so many. I’m thinking about those lost in this pandemic. 4/
I'm thankful for their families who sacrifice so much. And I'm grateful for our troops overseas who defend our country while we fight our own challenges here at home. 3/

I'm grateful for our teachers doctors nurses grocery store clerks health care experts firefighters first responders and all frontline workers for showing up for our country each and every day to do their essential jobs. 2/
Although many of us can't be with our loved ones today I still wanted to take a moment to say thank you. 1/
Happy birthday to the man who beat Donald Trump by more than 6 million votes.
